title: DNA extraction for vertebrate tissues using Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamylol
original description: This protocol is used to clarity the process of total DNA extration for L. maculatus genome.
steps:

2) The tissue was defrosted and washed with normal saline.Cut about 0.5g tissue.

2. Add STE, SDS (10%), protease K (20mg/ml) to mix. Heat 4-6h at 56℃, and shake in centrifuge at  500 rmp.

Phase separation
3. 1) Add the same volume of Phenol : Chloroform : Isoamylol (25: 24: 1) and mix by gentle inversion for 3-5 min at room temperature.
2) Centrifuge at 13600rpm for 10min at 4℃ and then transfer the supermatant aqueous phase in a new tube.
3) Add the same volume of Chloroform : Isoamylol (24 : 1) and mix by gently inverting for 3-5min at room temperature. 
4) Centrifuge at 13600rpm for 10min at 4℃ and then transfer the supermatant aqueous phase in a new tube.

5. 1) Add 1ml of 70% of ethanol, flick the centriguge tube to resuspend the pellet, wash the DNA pellet for 3-5min.
2) Centrifuge at 13000rpm for 5min at 4℃, discard the ethanol.
3) Add 1ml of 70% ethanol and mix gently. Centrifuge at 13000rpm for 5min at 4℃, discard the ethanol.
4) Centrifuge at 13000rpm for 30s, discard the liquid. Air dry the pellet for 5-10min at room temperature.
